section.name: Getting Started
section.p: You can get started with Apache Jackrabbit either by downloading the latest binary release or by building the source code yourself. Once you have the binaries available, check the first hops section for simple examples to get you up to speed.

If you have questions or comments about Jackrabbit, please send them to the Jackrabbit mailing lists. You are also welcome to file bug reports, improvement ideas, or other contributions to our issue tracker.
The Jackrabbit Wiki contains a few examples and tips. There is also a questions and answers page for questions about Jackrabbit.

section.name: Content Repository for Java Technology API (JCR)
section.p: Jackrabbit is a complete implementation of the JCR API, so the primary API for Jackrabbit application developers is to be found in the JCR section of the Documentation.

section.name: Jackrabbit architecture and Deployment Models
section.p: Find out more about the Jackrabbit Architecture or learn more about the Jackrabbit deployment Options be it as an embedded content repository to be delivered with you are application, a shared repository for example in a J2EE environment or a classical content repository server setup.

section.name: Node Types
section.p: To learn about the content modelling system used in Jackrabbit, read the section on node types.
